page.title: 14SECONDARY EDUCATION TH.BURY
page.content: At the age of 11 years all children attending state run schools transfer to a Secondary school. Children in Thornbury live within the "catchment area" of{The Castle Comprehensive {School}and therefore the majority attend this school. Some however elect to go to{Marlwood,}Alveston;the main difference being that Marlwood stream their pupils from 11 whereas The Castle teach mixed ability groups for the first 3 years. For the first 5 years children are taught within 7 faulties. These are:{English, Mathematics, P.E. and {Social Ed., Humanities, Languages, {Science, and Creative. In 1984 there were 248 pupils in the fifth year. Between them they gained 906{C.S.E.s;}and 763{G.C.E."O" Levels. The 78 pupils in the Upper Sixth gained 346{G.C.E."A" Levels.
